entry.content: A few months ago I switched from coffee to caffeine pills. By doing so I've managed to way reduce my caffeine intake, the alertness lasts longer and has less jitters. So I think it was a good move overall. But strangely I seem to have lost my desire to read? Previously I read voraciously pretty much every spare moment I had, but now for no clear reason i can't seem to make it past a few paragraphs without losing my interest. I've had to start listening to podcasts, which i always kind of struggled with, because it seems to be the only way i can cram info into my head. My desire to write has kind of gone in the same direction as well. I miss both of those things, but my overall mood and energy throughout the day are so much better that I havent switched back yet. And instead of reading and writing all the time I'm spending way more time hanging out with people face to face, which is probably good overall. I think my mood is also just better because im engaging less with politics and the culture war and all the toxicity that comes with that. I'm at a very weird place where i seem to have sort of inexplicably lost my main lifelong hobby, and it's definitely bothersome, but I'm not anywhere near as upset about it as I should be?
